example[0]: Car ownership is a virtual necessity when you live in the country.
example[1]: Finding a cheap place to rent is a virtual impossibility in this area.
definition[1]: made, done, seen etc on the Internet or on a computer, rather than in the real world
example[2]: The website allows you to take a virtual tour of the art gallery.
definition[2]: a virtual monopoly, ban, takeover etc is so nearly a complete monopoly, ban etc that any difference is unimportant
example[4]: They enjoy a virtual monopoly in sales of pickup trucks.
example[5]: Trading activity reached a virtual standstill.
definition[3]: computer software that gives you the experience of being in a place, or allows you to do the things that you would do in a real office, library etc
example[6]: In a virtual library, people can explore information resources from their desks.
definition[4]: a document etc that exists on a computer rather than in physical form
example[7]: Buying an air ticket involves the creation of several virtual documents.
